description:
Atari Collection 1 is the first of 10 releases available for the Evercade at its launch. It contains a total of 20 emulated Atari games from both the Atari 2600 and Atari 7800. The games included are:

  • Adventure (2600)
  • Alien Brigade (7800)
  • Aquaventure (2600)
  • Asteroids (2600)
  • Canyon Bomber (2600)
  • Centipede (2600)
  • Crystal Castles (2600)
  • Desert Falcon (2600)
  • Double Dunk (2600)
  • Food Fight (7800)
  • Gravitar (2600)
  • Missile Command (2600)
  • Motor Psycho (7800)
  • Night Driver (2600)
  • Ninja Golf (7800)
  • Steeplechase (2600)
  • SwordQuest: EarthWorld (2600)
  • Tempest (2600)
  • Video Pinball (2600)
  • Yars' Return (2600)
title: Atari Collection 1

description:
Namco Museum Collection 1 is the second of 10 releases available for the Evercade at its launch. It contains a total of 11 emulated Namco games from the NES, SNES, and Genesis. The games included are:

  • Battle Cars (SNES)
  • Dig Dug (NES)
  • Galaxian (NES)
  • Libble Rabble (SNES)
  • Mappy (NES)
  • Mappy Kids (NES)
  • Metal Marines (SNES)
  • Pac-Man (NES)
  • Quad Challenge (Genesis)
  • Star Luster (NES)
  • Xevious (NES)
title: Namco Museum Collection 1

description:
Data East Collection 1 is the third of 10 releases available for the Evercade at its launch. It contains a total of 10 emulated Data East games from the NES, SNES, and Genesis. The games included are:

  • Bad Dudes (NES)
  • BurgerTime (NES)
  • Burnin' Rubber (NES - version of Bump 'N' Jump with a modified title due to trademark issues)
  • Fighter's History (SNES)
  • Joe & Mac 2: Lost in the Tropics (SNES)
  • Karate Champ (NES)
  • Magical Drop 2 (SNES)
  • Midnight Resistance (Genesis)
  • Side Pocket (SNES)
  • Two Crude Dudes (Genesis)
title: Data East Collection 1

description:
Interplay Collection 1 is the fourth of 10 releases available for the Evercade at its launch. It contains a total of 6 emulated Interplay games from the NES, SNES, and Genesis. The games included are:

  • Clay Fighter (SNES)

description: The Evercade (Starter Pack) is one of three editions of the system that are available at launch. It includes the system itself and single bundled game, Namco Museum Collection 1.
title: Evercade (Starter Pack)

description: The Evercade (Premium Pack) is one of three editions of the system that are available at launch. It includes the system itself and 3 bundled games, Atari Collection 1, Interplay Collection 1, & Namco Museum Collection 1.
title: Evercade (Premium Pack)

description:
The Evercade (All-In Edition) is one of three editions of the system that are available at launch. It's available exclusively via Funstock and includes the system itself, a carry case, and all 10 games that are available for the system at launch. These are:

  • Atari Collection 1
  • Atari Collection 2
  • Data East Collection 1
  • Interplay Collection 1
  • Interplay Collection 2
  • Mega Cat Studios Collection 1
  • Namco Museum Collection 1
  • Namco Museum Collection 2
  • Piko Interactive Collection 1
  • Technōs Collection 1
title: Evercade (All-In Edition)

description:
The Oliver Twins Collection is the 12th official release for the Evercade. It comprises 11 NES titles created by Phillip and Andrew Oliver. All games are published under licence from Codemasters, with all profits being donated to the National Video Game Museum in Sheffield, England.

The games included are:

  • Dizzy the Adventurer
  • Dreamworld Pogie
  • The Fantastic Adventures of Dizzy
  • Firehawk
  • Go! Dizzy Go!
  • Panic! Dizzy
  • Professional BMX Simulator
  • Mystery World Dizzy
  • Super Robin Hood
  • Treasure Island Dizzy
  • Wonderland Dizzy
title: The Oliver Twins Collection

description:

description:
Jaleco Collection 1 is the 15th release for the Evercade. All 10 titles were originally published by (the now dissolved) Jaleco Ltd. for the NES or SNES in the 80's and 90's. The IP's are now owned by City Connection Co Ltd.

Technos Arcade 1 is the first in an arcade-only line of compilations for the Evercade and the 23rd cartridge release in total. It was a launch title for the Evercade VS console. It features eight games originally manufactured by Technos Corporation in the '80s and '90s.

The titles are:

Toaplan Arcade 1 is the 8th arcade collection for the Evercade. It features 8 games originally released by Toaplan in the '80s and '90s.

description:
This release is a dual cartridge. It contains two "modern retro" titles, Alwa's Awakening and Cathedral, both of which are exploratory platformers. In Alwa's Awakening, a young girl named Zoe is called to another world to save them from a terrible fate, while in Cathedral, an unnamed knight awakens in the titular place of worship with no memory of who they are or what they were doing.

Both games are exploratory platformers in which the protagonist gradually earns new abilities by completing various milestones such as defeating bosses or finding particular items. Alwa's Awakening places a strong focus on using magic to solve puzzles (often with a strong dexterity element) while Cathedral features a mix of helpful items that aid traversal and assist in combat.

Alwa's Awakening was originally developed for modern systems, but the version on this cartridge is the 8-bit version that was ported to NES. Cathedral, meanwhile, is a modern game and was ported natively to Evercade, making it the first commercially released native game for the platform that is not running on emulation.
title: Alwa's Awakening / Cathedral

description:
Indie Heroes Collection 2 is a compilation of independently developed modern retro games that were initially distributed as free downloads via the Evercade VS' "Game of the Month" program and subsequently collected together with several additional games to form this cartridge.

The games in this collection include:

  • Beer Slinger
  • The Cowlitz Gamers Adventure Trilogy
  • Eyra, The Crow Maiden
  • Gelatinous: Humanity Lost
  • The Gruniożerca Trilogy
  • Lunar Journey
  • Nessy the Robot
  • Nix: The Paradox Relic
  • Reknum Souls Adventure
  • Tapeworm Disco Puzzle
  • Yeah Yeah Beebiss II
title: Indie Heroes Collection 2

description:
This compilation brings together three Duke Nukem games on a single cartridge:

  • Duke Nukem (Remastered)
  • Duke Nukem II (Remastered)
  • Duke Nukem 3D: Total Meltdown

The first two games come with touched-up graphics, newly-composed music tracks, widescreen support and smooth scrolling.
title: Duke Nukem 1+2 Remastered / Duke Nukem 3D: Total Meltdown
